intro: Meborea guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan meborea, is a tropical plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its habitat specificity, Meborea guianensis is considered a rare and endangered species.
